Description: Body sherd of Silhouette Style Corinthian pottery plate; interior, from centre: single band; painted decoration (fired red) consisting of animal frieze (back, underbelly, and hind legs of goat, to left; hind leg of possible lion, to right); hailstorm as filling ornament; two bands; exterior reserved save for red-fired bands.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Leiden University, Faculty of Archaeology. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
For parallels, see Oxford AN1896-1908-G.127.1c and Louvre AM1362 (16).
Bibliographic references: van de Wiel 1968 / Verzameling ceramiek en Terracotta's Archaeologisch Instituut der Rijksuniversiteit Leiden (p. 8, no. N 26)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GB.271) (phase 3)
Prins de Jong 1925 / Scherben aus Naukratis: Aus der Sammlung des Universitäts-Professors Dr Fr W Freih von Bissing (p. 56, no. 1)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: T.2931 (Musée Scheurleer (The Hague) Registration number)
